summary: "Anna Karenina" is a famous novel by Russian author Leo Tolstoy, published in 1878. It tells the story of Anna, a woman who has an affair with a cavalry officer, Count Vronsky. This scandalizes society and leads them to flee to Italy. Upon their return to Russia, their lives become even more complicated. The book explores themes like love, marriage, and society in Imperial Russia. It's considered one of the best novels ever written and has been made into many movies and TV shows. Trains are also an important symbol in the story.
title: Anna Karenina
